channel.title: Comments on: Trying the Stand-Up Desk
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: julie
item.dc:creator: julie
item.description: Do you have any suggestions for a stand in a cubicle that is adjustable so when your tired of standing you can adjust the keyboard and computer down and sit. Most I've seen are for desk and require too big of a mount for a cubicle. Thnx
item.content:encoded: Do you have any suggestions for a stand in a cubicle that is adjustable so when your tired of standing you can adjust the keyboard and computer down and sit. Most I’ve seen are for desk and require too big of a mount for a cubicle. Thnx

item.title: By: Cassie Anderson
item.dc:creator: Cassie Anderson
item.description:
I recently strained my back and am on doctors orders to stand while at work. I have been trying to look for relatively inexpensive methods of creating a standing work station. (currently I have my file cabinet in my cube with my computer on it. I love the pictures you posted and completely agree that standing while at work actually does make me feel more energized. Plus I am not in agonizing pain from sitting all day anymore.
All in all thank you for the post and for the great ideas.
item.content:encoded:
I recently strained my back and am on doctors orders to stand while at work. I have been trying to look for relatively inexpensive methods of creating a standing work station. (currently I have my file cabinet in my cube with my computer on it. I love the pictures you posted and completely agree that standing while at work actually does make me feel more energized. Plus I am not in agonizing pain from sitting all day anymore.

All in all thank you for the post and for the great ideas.

item.title: By: Bob Clark
item.dc:creator: Bob Clark
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been using a standing desk for nine-plus years (and counting).

For the sore-feet issue, I wear hiking boots every day. The extra support around the ankles makes standing all day easy-peasy.

item.title: By: grogenaut
item.dc:creator: grogenaut
item.description: 2 Words: Cinder Blocks. Super cheap, Super Strong. Nice cheap way to raise your desk up and try standing without spending more thatn $15
item.content:encoded: 2 Words: Cinder Blocks. Super cheap, Super Strong. Nice cheap way to raise your desk up and try standing without spending more thatn $15

item.title: By: Laura
item.dc:creator: Laura
item.description: I've been using one of these keyboard and monitor risers and it works good. www.staandupdesk.com easy to move from sitting to standing and affordable & nice looking compared to other options.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been using one of these keyboard and monitor risers and it works good. http://www.staandupdesk.com/ easy to move from sitting to standing and affordable & nice looking compared to other options.

item.title: By: Neil Ding
item.dc:creator: Neil Ding
item.description: In fact there is a easy way, in which I am using, to setup the standing up desk: getting a carton box (as the one containing your air conditioner) on the desk. It is big and solid enough to place a monitor, a keyboard and a mouse on it.
item.content:encoded: In fact there is a easy way, in which I am using, to setup the standing up desk: getting a carton box (as the one containing your air conditioner) on the desk. It is big and solid enough to place a monitor, a keyboard and a mouse on it.

item.title: By: Jude
item.dc:creator: Jude
item.content:encoded:
Hi Eli!

Grats on taking the plunge. You’re going to love it, but your first couple of weeks are going to be tiring.

I’ve been using a standing desk for about two years now. Prior to that, I tried *and failed* a few times. The things that lead me to succeed:

1. The height of the desk needs to be perfect. If your wrists feel any sort of pain after a day at your desk, the height is off by as little as an inch.

2. You need a padded mat to stand on. It substantially reduces the fatigue on your feet and back. I couldn’t stand all day until I got one, but now I’m totally comfortable. I purchased http://www.amazon.com/Sublime-Imprint-Anti-Fatigue-Nantucket-Cinnamon/dp/B003BYRDK2/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1349627923&sr=8-2&keywords=standing+pad and it worked out well for me.

item.title: By: plumbing supplies
item.dc:creator: plumbing supplies
item.description: I agree with you. Stand up desk is also one of the most used desk. It is very comfortable to use and easy to adjust.
item.content:encoded: I agree with you. Stand up desk is also one of the most used desk. It is very comfortable to use and easy to adjust.

item.title: By: Height Adjustable Desks
item.dc:creator: Height Adjustable Desks
item.description: Thanks so much for the detailed specs! I'll check it out at the local(wish) Lowes. Last week, I made a rough prototype with boxes to give standing a try for a day or so. I definitely felt much more focused and energized while working, but I think I'll need more raised platforms/space to give me more surface area for my usual workspace sprawl. Thanks, again, for the details!
item.content:encoded: Thanks so much for the detailed specs! I’ll check it out at the local(wish) Lowes. Last week, I made a rough prototype with boxes to give standing a try for a day or so. I definitely felt much more focused and energized while working, but I think I’ll need more raised platforms/space to give me more surface area for my usual workspace sprawl. Thanks, again, for the details!

item.title: By: Cave Dad
item.dc:creator: Cave Dad
item.content:encoded:
Hi Eli,

Still standing a year later? I’m curious if people find standing sustainable, or if they go back to sitting after awhile.

Cave Dad
